title: Specifying alerting rules
text: One alerting rules can specified within alert_rules() object, passed alert_rules parameter.

title: Specifying alerting rules
text: number built-rules can used test simple conditions, simplest testing presence missing values. extent_type extent_value parameters can used adjust tolerance. E.g. alert_equals(), alert_below(), alert_above() rules work similarly, extra parameter rule_value compare . also possible compare range values another range values using alert_difference_above_perc() alert_difference_below_perc() rules. can useful checking recent values lower/higher previous period, particular percentage. comparison based mean values two periods. ranges contiguous, denote positions end time series. E.g.
code: # alert if all values are NA ars <- alert_rules(alert_missing(extent_type = "all"))  # alert if there are 10 or more missing values in total # or if the last 3 or more values are missing # or if 5 or more values in a row are missing ars <- alert_rules(   alert_missing(extent_type = "any", extent_value = 10),   alert_missing(extent_type = "last", extent_value = 3),   alert_missing(extent_type = "consecutive", extent_value = 5) ) # alert if the mean of last 3 values is more than 20% higher than the mean of the preceding 12 values ars <- alert_rules(   alert_difference_above_perc(current_period = 1:3, previous_period = 4:15, rule_value = 20) )

title: Specifying alerting rules
text: want apply complex rule, can specify using alert_custom(). E.g. function_call evaluated per time series, expression inside quote() must return either TRUE FALSE. return value TRUE means alert result “FAIL” Column names can used explicitly expression value timepoint, refer values value_col timepoint_col columns data respectively. evaluating function_call, dataframe grouped item_col ordered timepoint_col.
code: ars <- alert_rules(   alert_custom(     short_name = "my_rule_combo",     description = "Over 3 missing values and max value is > 10",     function_call = quote(sum(is.na(value)) > 3 && max(value, na.rm = TRUE) > 10)   ),   alert_custom(     short_name = "my_rule_doubled",     description = "Last value is over double the first value",     function_call = quote(rev(value)[1] > 2*value[1])   ) )

what: Applying different rules to different time series
title: Specifying alerting rules
text: default, specified rules run time series supplied dataframe. can specify different sets rules different time series using items parameter, providing named list character vectors corresponding item_cols columns values particular rule applied .

title: Specifying alerting rules
text: Generate interactive mantis report example_prescription_numbers dataset supplied mantis package. SITE1 tab, Vancomycin time series contains block NA values easy distinguish NA values zero values unless zoom plot (selecting section mouse) hover mouse relevant time points read tooltips.  can easily add rule test missing values. ’re , also add custom rule try catch fact Coamoxiclav prescriptions become much higher start. report now includes column alert results, details can seen clicking triangles. Also, tab labels include exclamation mark items tab failed alert rule.  reason wanted apply custom rule broad spectrum antibiotics, can indicate using items parameter rule. report now shows two rules Coamoxiclav one rule Metronidazole.
code: library(mantis)  data("example_prescription_numbers") mantis_report(   df = example_prescription_numbers,   inputspec = inputspec(     timepoint_col = "PrescriptionDate",     item_cols = c("Antibiotic", "Spectrum", "Location"),     value_col = "NumberOfPrescriptions",     tab_col = "Location"   ),   outputspec = outputspec_interactive(     sync_axis_range = FALSE   ),   report_title = "mantis report",   dataset_description = "Antibiotic prescriptions by site",   save_filename = "example_prescription_numbers_interactive",   show_progress = TRUE ) ars <- alert_rules(   alert_missing(extent_type = "any", extent_value = 1),   alert_custom(     short_name = "my_rule_doubled",     description = "Last 7 values are over double the first 7 values",     function_call = quote(mean(rev(value)[1:7], na.rm = TRUE) > 2*(mean(value[1:7], na.rm = TRUE)))   ) )  # create a new report mantis_report(   df = example_prescription_numbers,   inputspec = inputspec(     timepoint_col = "PrescriptionDate",     item_cols = c("Antibiotic", "Spectrum", "Location"),     value_col = "NumberOfPrescriptions",     tab_col = "Location"   ),   outputspec = outputspec_interactive(     sync_axis_range = FALSE   ),   alert_rules = ars,   report_title = "mantis report with alerts",   dataset_description = "Antibiotic prescriptions by site",   save_filename = "example_prescription_numbers_interactive_alerts",   show_progress = TRUE ) ars_restricted <- alert_rules(   alert_missing(extent_type = "any", extent_value = 1),   alert_custom(     short_name = "my_rule_doubled",     description = "Last 7 values are over double the first 7 values",     function_call = quote(mean(rev(value)[1:7], na.rm = TRUE) > 2*(mean(value[1:7], na.rm = TRUE))),     items = list("Spectrum" = c("Broad"))   ) )  # create a new report mantis_report(   df = example_prescription_numbers,   inputspec = inputspec(     timepoint_col = "PrescriptionDate",     item_cols = c("Antibiotic", "Spectrum", "Location"),     value_col = "NumberOfPrescriptions",     tab_col = "Location"   ),   outputspec = outputspec_interactive(     sync_axis_range = FALSE   ),   alert_rules = ars_restricted,   report_title = "mantis report with alerts",   dataset_description = "Antibiotic prescriptions by site",   save_filename = "example_prescription_numbers_interactive_alerts_restricted",   show_progress = TRUE )

title: Creating bespoke reports
text: can use existing rmarkdown functionality create bespoke html report, insert mantis content /tabs desired. minimum, need know generate html documents Rmd file, including creating tabsets. don’t, take look official documentation /many online resources available. mantis includes one main function bespoke_rmd_tab() creating content bespoke reports. function use side-effects generate desired markdown, must placed inside {r, results='asis'} chunk. function can: add single visualisation, without creating container tab, add set tabs, based output specification, without creating parent tab. function also includes additional parameters available standard mantis_report() allow extra control display.

title: Creating bespoke reports
text: Due complexities way dygraphs widgets rendered, two additional chunks must included Rmd file, otherwise graphs can disappear unexpectedly. Firstly, add following chunk Rmd file ensure dygraphs plots initialised. Remember set plot_type one using rest report. best placed bottom file can lead extra line space. Secondly, browser window resized, dygraphs plots inactive tabs disappear. workaround redraw reloading page. , add following chunk top Rmd file.
code: ```{r} # this chunk is necessary when using mantis::outputspec_interactive().  # it ensures that the dygraphs render when built using `cat()` # set the plot_type to the same plot_type as the real output mantis::bespoke_rmd_initialise_widgets(plot_type = "bar") ``` ```{js} // this chunk is necessary when using mantis::outputspec_interactive().  // when the browser window is resized, all dygraphs on inactive tabs disappear. Reload page to  // redraw them all. window.onresize = function(){ location.reload(); } ```

title: Get started with mantis
text: data frame containing time series long format, following columns (though actual column names can different): one “timepoint” (date) column used x-axes. currently must daily granularity, values consecutive. one “item” (character) columns containing categorical values identifying distinct time series. one “value” (numeric) column containing time series values used y-axes. Example: example_prescription_numbers dataset provided package, contains (synthetic) examples aggregate numbers antibiotic prescriptions given hospital period year. contains 5 columns: PrescriptionDate - date prescriptions written Antibiotic - name antibiotic prescribed Spectrum - spectrum activity antibiotic. value always particular antibiotic NumberOfPrescriptions - number prescriptions written antibiotic day Location - hospital site prescription written
code: # first, attach the package if you haven't already library(mantis)  # this example data frame contains numbers of antibiotic prescriptions in long format data("example_prescription_numbers")  head(example_prescription_numbers) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   PrescriptionDate Antibiotic    Spectrum NumberOfPrescriptions Location #>   <date>           <chr>         <chr>                    <dbl> <chr>    #> 1 2022-01-01       Coamoxiclav   Broad                       45 SITE1    #> 2 2022-01-01       Gentamicin    Broad                       34 SITE1    #> 3 2022-01-01       Ceftriaxone   Broad                       36 SITE1    #> 4 2022-01-01       Metronidazole Limited                     17 SITE1    #> 5 2022-01-01       Meropenem     Broad                       10 SITE1    #> 6 2022-01-01       Vancomycin    Limited                      0 SITE1

title: Get started with mantis
text: must specify column(s) supplied data frame used identify individual time series (items), columns contain timepoint (x-axis) value (y-axis) time series. set using item_cols, timepoint_col value_col parameters inputspec() respectively. columns data frame ignored. Optionally, multiple columns specified item_cols, one can used group time series different tabs report, using tab_col parameter. Members item_cols specified order want appear output. Example: example_prescription_numbers dataset , combination “Antibiotic” “Location” columns uniquely identify time series data frame, columns must included item_cols. “Spectrum” column can also added item_cols well desired, case appear output additional column/label. Otherwise ignored. options specifying data columns, depending want report look:
code: # create a flat report, and include the "Location" and "Antibiotic" fields in the content inspec_flat <- inputspec(   timepoint_col = "PrescriptionDate",   item_cols = c("Location", "Antibiotic"),   value_col = "NumberOfPrescriptions" )  # create a flat report, and include the "Location", "Spectrum", and "Antibiotic" fields in the # content inspec_flat2 <- inputspec(   timepoint_col = "PrescriptionDate",   item_cols = c("Location", "Spectrum", "Antibiotic"),   value_col = "NumberOfPrescriptions" )  # create a tabbed report, with a separate tab for each unique value of "Location", and include just # the "Antibiotic" field in the content of each tab inspec_tabbed <- inputspec(   timepoint_col = "PrescriptionDate",   item_cols = c("Antibiotic", "Location"),   value_col = "NumberOfPrescriptions",   tab_col = "Location" )  # create a tabbed report, with a separate tab for each unique value of "Location", and include the # "Antibiotic" and "Spectrum" fields in the content of each tab inspec_tabbed2 <- inputspec(   timepoint_col = "PrescriptionDate",   item_cols = c("Antibiotic", "Spectrum", "Location"),   value_col = "NumberOfPrescriptions",   tab_col = "Location" )  # create a tabbed report, with a separate tab for each unique value of "Antibiotic", and include # just the "Location" field in the content of each tab inspec_tabbed3 <- inputspec(   timepoint_col = "PrescriptionDate",   item_cols = c("Antibiotic", "Location"),   value_col = "NumberOfPrescriptions",   tab_col = "Antibiotic" )

title: Get started with mantis
text: simplest way create report use mantis_report() function. need decide save report, optionally specify filename (excluding file extension). filename can contain alphanumeric, - _ characters. filename supplied, one automatically generated. can also optionally specify short description dataset, appear report. 3 different options visualising time series. set using outputspec parameter.

title: Get started with mantis
text: default visualisation, produces table one time series row, orderable filterable columns showing previously-specified item_cols identifying time series. Also table maximum value time series, bar plots adjustable axes tooltips showing individual dates values. options adjusting output, changing column labels, plot type, whether use y-axis scale across table. can done using outputspec_interactive() function supplying outputspec parameter. Example: example_prescription_numbers dataset , save report current directory, separate tabs hospital site.
code: mantis_report(   df = example_prescription_numbers,   inputspec = inspec_tabbed2,   outputspec = outputspec_interactive(),   report_title = "mantis report",   dataset_description = "Antibiotic prescriptions by site",   save_filename = "example_prescription_numbers_interactive",   show_progress = TRUE )

title: Get started with mantis
text: Alternatively, report can output static plots. can useful interactivity needed, file sizes need kept small. currently two types static visualisations: heatmap multipanel, selected using outputspec_static_heatmap() outputspec_static_multipanel() function supplying outputspec parameter.

title: Get started with mantis
code: mantis_report(   df = example_prescription_numbers,   inputspec = inspec_tabbed,   outputspec = outputspec_static_heatmap(),   report_title = "mantis report",   dataset_description = "Antibiotic prescriptions by site",   save_filename = "example_prescription_numbers_heatmap",   show_progress = TRUE )

title: Get started with mantis
code: mantis_report(   df = example_prescription_numbers,   inputspec = inspec_tabbed,   outputspec = outputspec_static_multipanel(),   report_title = "mantis report",   dataset_description = "Antibiotic prescriptions by site",   save_filename = "example_prescription_numbers_multipanel",   show_progress = TRUE )

title: Authors and Citation
text: T. Phuong Quan. Author, maintainer. University Oxford. Copyright holder. National Institute Health Research (NIHR). Funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Quan TP (2025). mantis: Multiple Time Series Scanner. R package version 0.1.2.9000, https://phuongquan.github.io/mantis/, https://github.com/phuongquan/mantis.
code: @Manual{,   title = {mantis: Multiple Time Series Scanner},   author = {T. Phuong Quan},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.2.9000,     https://phuongquan.github.io/mantis/},   url = {https://github.com/phuongquan/mantis}, }

title: Multiple Time Series Scanner
text: mantis package generates interactive html reports enable quick visual review multiple related time series. can help identification temporal artefacts unexpected trends. time series visualisations include adjustable axes tooltips showing individual dates values. data frame containing time series long format, .e.: one “timepoint” (date) column used x-axes. currently must daily granularity, values consecutive. one “item” (character) columns containing categorical values identifying distinct time series. one “value” (numeric) column containing time series values used y-axes. inputspec parameter maps data frame columns , can optionally include column grouping time series tabs. reports shareable can contribute forming transparent record entire analysis process. designed electronic health records mind, can used types time series.

title: Multiple Time Series Scanner
code: # install direct from source # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("phuongquan/mantis")

title: Multiple Time Series Scanner
code: library(mantis)  # this example data frame contains numbers of antibiotic prescriptions in long format,  #   plus a column for grouping the output: data("example_prescription_numbers")  head(example_prescription_numbers) ## # A tibble: 6 × 5 ##   PrescriptionDate Antibiotic    Spectrum NumberOfPrescriptions Location ##   <date>           <chr>         <chr>                    <dbl> <chr>    ## 1 2022-01-01       Coamoxiclav   Broad                       45 SITE1    ## 2 2022-01-01       Gentamicin    Broad                       34 SITE1    ## 3 2022-01-01       Ceftriaxone   Broad                       36 SITE1    ## 4 2022-01-01       Metronidazole Limited                     17 SITE1    ## 5 2022-01-01       Meropenem     Broad                       10 SITE1    ## 6 2022-01-01       Vancomycin    Limited                      0 SITE1 # create a report in the current directory mantis_report(   df = example_prescription_numbers,   inputspec = inputspec(     timepoint_col = "PrescriptionDate",     item_cols = c("Location", "Antibiotic", "Spectrum"),     value_col = "NumberOfPrescriptions",     tab_col = "Location"   ) )

title: Multiple Time Series Scanner
text: work supported National Institute Health Research Health Protection Research Unit (NIHR HPRU) Healthcare Associated Infections Antimicrobial Resistance University Oxford partnership Public Health England (PHE) (NIHR200915), NIHR Oxford Biomedical Research Centre.

title: Multiple Time Series Scanner
text: Please report bugs suggestions opening github issue.

what: Test for values greater than a specific value — alert_above
title: Test for values greater than a specific value — alert_above
text: Configure rule test time series presence values greater specific value. Tolerance can adjusted using extent_type extent_value parameters, see Examples details.

title: Test for values greater than a specific value — alert_above
code: alert_above(extent_type = "all", extent_value = 1, rule_value, items = NULL)

title: Test for values greater than a specific value — alert_above
text: extent_type "", "", "last", "consecutive" extent_value lower limit extent. e.g. extent_type="" extent_value=5 means alert 5 values satisfy condition, position rule_value value test . e.g. rule_value=1 means alert value greater 1 items named list names corresponding members item_cols. List members character vectors values contained named column rule applied . items = NULL rule applied items. See Details.

title: Test for values greater than a specific value — alert_above
text: alert_rule object

title: Test for values greater than a specific value — alert_above
text: Use items restrict rule applied specified items. items can either NULL named list character vectors. NULL, rule applied items. named list, names must match members item_cols parameter inputspec, (well column names df), though can subset. item_col named list, rule apply members. item_col named list, rule applied item_col's value contained corresponding character vector. multiple item_cols specified, rule applied items satisfy conditions.

title: Test for values greater than a specific value — alert_above
code: # alert if all values are greater than 50 ars <- alert_rules(alert_below(extent_type = "all", rule_value = 50))  # alert if there are 10 or more values that are greater than 50 # or if the last 3 or more values are greater than 60 # or if 5 or more values in a row are greater than 40 ars <- alert_rules(   alert_below(extent_type = "any", extent_value = 10, rule_value = 50),   alert_below(extent_type = "last", extent_value = 3, rule_value = 60),   alert_below(extent_type = "consecutive", extent_value = 5, rule_value = 40) )

text: Configure rule test time series presence values less specific value. Tolerance can adjusted using extent_type extent_value parameters, see Examples details.

text: extent_type "", "", "last", "consecutive" extent_value lower limit extent. e.g. extent_type="" extent_value=5 means alert 5 values satisfy condition, position rule_value value test . e.g. rule_value=1 means alert value less 1 items named list names corresponding members item_cols. List members character vectors values contained named column rule applied . items = NULL rule applied items. See Details.

title: Test for values less than a specific value — alert_below
text: Use items restrict rule applied specified items. items can either NULL named list character vectors. NULL, rule applied items. named list, names must match members item_cols parameter inputspec, (well column names df), though can subset. item_col named list, rule apply members. item_col named list, rule applied item_col's value contained corresponding character vector. multiple item_cols specified, rule applied items satisfy conditions.

title: Test for values less than a specific value — alert_below
code: # alert if all values are less than 2 ars <- alert_rules(alert_below(extent_type = "all", rule_value = 2))  # alert if there are 10 or more values that are less than 7 # or if the last 3 or more values are less than 2 # or if 5 or more values in a row are less than 7 ars <- alert_rules(   alert_below(extent_type = "any", extent_value = 10, rule_value = 7),   alert_below(extent_type = "last", extent_value = 3, rule_value = 2),   alert_below(extent_type = "consecutive", extent_value = 5, rule_value = 7) )

what: Create a custom alert rule — alert_custom
title: Create a custom alert rule — alert_custom
text: supplied function_call passed eval() within dplyr::summarise() grouping item_cols ordering timepoint_col. Column names can used explicitly expression value timepoint, refer values value_col timepoint_col columns data respectively.

title: Create a custom alert rule — alert_custom
code: alert_custom(short_name, description, function_call, items = NULL)

title: Create a custom alert rule — alert_custom
text: short_name short name uniquely identify rule. include alphanumeric, '-', '_' characters. description short description rule checks function_call call evaluated per item, returns either TRUE FALSE. Return value TRUE means alert result "FAIL". See Details. items named list names corresponding members item_cols. List members character vectors values contained named column rule applied . items = NULL rule applied items. See Details.

title: Create a custom alert rule — alert_custom
text: alert_rule object

title: Create a custom alert rule — alert_custom
text: Use items restrict rule applied specified items. items can either NULL named list character vectors. NULL, rule applied items. named list, names must match members item_cols parameter inputspec, (well column names df), though can subset. item_col named list, rule apply members. item_col named list, rule applied item_col's value contained corresponding character vector. multiple item_cols specified, rule applied items satisfy conditions.

title: Create a custom alert rule — alert_custom
code: ars <- alert_rules(   alert_custom(     short_name = "my_rule_combo",     description = "Over 3 missing values and max value is > 10",     function_call = quote(sum(is.na(value)) > 3 && max(value, na.rm = TRUE) > 10)   ),   alert_custom(     short_name = "my_rule_doubled",     description = "Last value is over double the first value",     function_call = quote(rev(value)[1] > 2*value[1])   ) )

Can overlap current_period desired. rule_value value test . e.g. rule_value=5 means alert percentage increase greater 5 items named list names corresponding members item_cols. List members character vectors values contained named column rule applied . items = NULL rule applied items. See Details.

title: Initialise HTML widgets — bespoke_rmd_initialise_widgets
text: output constructed results='asis' chunks, must also least one standard chunk contains relevant widgets, otherwise render. dygraph also needs initialised appropriate plot_type. See https://github.com/rstudio/rmarkdown/issues/1877 info. Note: chunk currently appears like line break rendered.

title: Initialise HTML widgets — bespoke_rmd_initialise_widgets
code: bespoke_rmd_initialise_widgets(plot_type)

title: Initialise HTML widgets — bespoke_rmd_initialise_widgets
text: plot_type "bar" "line", depending used real tables.

title: Initialise HTML widgets — bespoke_rmd_initialise_widgets

what: Dynamically generate a tab or group of tabs for an rmd chunk — bespoke_rmd_tab
title: Dynamically generate a tab or group of tabs for an rmd chunk — bespoke_rmd_tab
text: Chunk options must contain results = 'asis'. Function writes directly chunk using side-effects

title: Dynamically generate a tab or group of tabs for an rmd chunk — bespoke_rmd_tab
code: bespoke_rmd_tab(   df,   inputspec,   outputspec,   alert_rules = NULL,   timepoint_limits = c(NA, NA),   fill_with_zero = FALSE,   tab_name = NULL,   tab_level = 1 )

title: Dynamically generate a tab or group of tabs for an rmd chunk — bespoke_rmd_tab
text: df data frame containing multiple time series long format. See Details. inputspec inputspec() object specifying columns supplied df represent "timepoint", "item", "value" time series. separate tab created distinct value "tab" column. outputspec outputspec object specifying desired format html table(s)/plot(s). supplied, default values used. alert_rules alert_rules() object specifying conditions test timepoint_limits Set start end dates time period include. Defaults min/max timepoint_col fill_with_zero Logical. Replace missing NA values 0? Useful value_col record count tab_name Character string appear tab label. omitted NULL, content/child tabs (parent tab) created. tab_level integer specifying nesting level tab. tab_name specified, value 1 generates tab rmd level "##", tab_col tabs level . tab_name specified, tab_col tabs created rmd level "##".

title: Dynamically generate a tab or group of tabs for an rmd chunk — bespoke_rmd_tab
text: (invisibly) supplied df

title: Dynamically generate a tab or group of tabs for an rmd chunk — bespoke_rmd_tab
text: supplied data frame contain multiple time series long format, .e.: one "timepoint" (date) column used x-axes. currently must daily granularity, values consecutive. one "item" (character) columns containing categorical values identifying distinct time series. one "value" (numeric) column containing time series values used y-axes. inputspec parameter maps data frame columns . Optionally, multiple columns specified item_cols, one can used group time series different tabs report, using tab_col parameter.

title: Specify relevant columns in the source data frame — inputspec
text: timepoint_col String denoting (date) column used x-axes. item_cols String denoting (character) column containing categorical values identifying distinct time series. Multiple columns together identify time series can provided vector value_col String denoting (numeric) column containing time series values used y-axes. tab_col Optional. String denoting (character) column containing categorical values used group time series different tabs report. period periodicity timepoint_col values. "day"/"month"/"year"

title: Generate a data frame containing alert results — mantis_alerts
code: mantis_alerts(   df,   inputspec,   alert_rules,   filter_results = c("PASS", "FAIL", "NA"),   timepoint_limits = c(NA, NA),   fill_with_zero = FALSE )

title: Generate a data frame containing alert results — mantis_alerts
text: df data frame containing multiple time series long format. See Details. inputspec inputspec() object specifying columns supplied df represent "timepoint", "item", "value"  (optionally) "tab" time series. "item-tab" represents individual time series alert_rules alert_rules() object specifying conditions test filter_results return rows alert result vector values timepoint_limits Set start end dates time period include. Defaults min/max timepoint_col. Can either Date values NAs. fill_with_zero Replace missing NA values 0? Useful value_col record count

title: Generate a data frame containing alert results — mantis_alerts
text: tibble

what: Create an interactive time series report from a data frame — mantis_report
title: Create an interactive time series report from a data frame — mantis_report
text: Accepts data frame containing multiple time series long format, generates collection interactive time series plots visual inspection, saves report disk.

title: Create an interactive time series report from a data frame — mantis_report
code: mantis_report(   df,   inputspec,   outputspec = NULL,   alert_rules = NULL,   report_title = "mantis report",   dataset_description = "",   save_directory = ".",   save_filename = NULL,   show_progress = TRUE,   ... )

title: Create an interactive time series report from a data frame — mantis_report
text: df data frame containing multiple time series long format. See Details. inputspec inputspec() object specifying columns supplied df represent "timepoint", "item", "value"  (optionally) "tab" time series. "tab" column specified, separate tab created distinct value column. outputspec outputspec object specifying desired format html table(s). supplied, default values used. alert_rules alert_rules() object specifying conditions test report_title Title appear report. dataset_description Short description dataset shown. appear report. save_directory String specifying directory save report. Default current directory. save_filename String specifying filename report, excluding file extension. filename supplied, one automatically generated format mantis_report_YYMMDD_HHMMSS. show_progress Print progress console. Default = TRUE. ... parameters passed rmarkdown::render(). include input, output_dir, output_file, params, quiet.

title: Create an interactive time series report from a data frame — mantis_report
text: string containing name path saved report.

title: Create an interactive time series report from a data frame — mantis_report
text: supplied data frame contain multiple time series long format, .e.: one "timepoint" (date) column used x-axes. currently must daily granularity, values consecutive. one "item" (character) column containing categorical values identifying distinct time series. one "value" (numeric) column containing time series values used y-axes. Optionally, "tab" (character) column containing categorical values used group time series different tabs report. inputspec parameter maps data frame columns .

what: Specify output options for the report — outputspec_interactive
title: Specify output options for the report — outputspec_interactive
text: Specify output options report

title: Specify output options for the report — outputspec_interactive
code: outputspec_interactive(   plot_value_type = "value",   plot_type = "bar",   item_label = NULL,   plot_label = NULL,   summary_cols = c("max_value"),   sync_axis_range = FALSE,   item_order = NULL,   sort_by = NULL )

title: Specify output options for the report — outputspec_interactive
text: plot_value_type Display raw "value" time series display calculated "delta" consecutive values. plot_type Display time series "bar" "line" chart. item_label String label(s) use "item" column(s) report. NULL, original columns name(s) used. plot_label String label use time series column report. NULL, original value_col name used. summary_cols Summary data include columns report. Options c("max_value", "last_value", "last_value_nonmissing", "last_timepoint", "mean_value"). sync_axis_range Set y-axis range time series table. X-axes always synced. item_order named list corresponding item_cols columns ordering items output. List values either TRUE ascending order, character vector values contained named column explicit ordering. item_order = NULL, original order kept. See Details. sort_by column output table sort . Can one alert_overall, one summary columns. Append minus sign sort descending order e.g. -max_value. Secondary ordering based item_order.

title: Specify output options for the report — outputspec_interactive
text: outputspec() object

title: Specify output options for the report — outputspec_interactive
text: item_order, names list members correspond column names df. names match ignored. multiple columns specified, sorted together, priority order list. list item TRUE column sorted ascending order. list item character vector column sorted order vector first, remaining values included alphabetically end. want order tabs, recommended put tab_col first item list.

title: mantis (development version)
text: Breaking changes inputspec() now takes item_cols parameter, allowing one column df define individual time series, must include column used tabs (). items parameter alert rules now takes list items item_order parameter outputspec() now takes list items, allows ordering tabs bespoke_rmd_tab() replaces bespoke_rmd_tab_group() bespoke_rmd_tab_item() changes example_prescription_numbers dataset now additional data

title: mantis 0.1.2 (2025-01-15)
text: Pre-release. Expect breaking changes functions future. Complete list functions exported: alert_above() alert_below() alert_custom() alert_difference_above_perc() alert_difference_below_perc() alert_equals() alert_missing() alert_rules() bespoke_rmd_initialise_widgets() bespoke_rmd_tab_group() bespoke_rmd_tab_item() inputspec() mantis_alerts() mantis_report() outputspec_interactive() outputspec_static_heatmap() outputspec_static_multipanel()
